sentences.en: Absolutizing what is not absolute but relative is called totalitarianism.
sentences.cn: 把不是绝对的相对当作绝对,这就叫做极权主义.

sentences.en: Every line of serious work that I have written since 1936 has been written, directly or indirectly, against totalitarianism and for democratic socialism, as I understand it.
sentences.cn: 1936年以来，我的严肃作品中的每一行都是为间接或直接地反对极权主义，拥护我所理解的民主社会主义而写的。

sentences.en: Ignorance and poverty , which go hand in hand with totalitarianism and control , continue to be widespread.
sentences.cn: 极权和专制总是与愚昧和贫穷一路相伴, 贻害四方.

sentences.en: It is a force that I am sure will one day make totalitarianism impossible.
sentences.cn: 它是一种强迫力,我相信有一天它会是极权主义成为不可能.

sentences.en: The accusations of utopianism, elitism, totalitarianism and sexism have constantly recurred.
sentences.cn: 针对空想主义 、 精英主义 、 极权主义和性别歧视主义的职责一直此起彼伏.

sentences.en: The genealogy of antignosticism is complex, but there is where the origins of totalitarianism are to be found.
sentences.cn: 反灵知主义的谱系是复杂的，但是就是在这里我们能够找到极权主义的起源。

sentences.en: Under totalitarianism, fairy tales good and bad often trumped truth.
sentences.cn: 在极权主义下,故事不论好坏总胜过事实.

trans.tran_en: Totalitarianism is the ideas, principles, and practices of totalitarian political systems
